title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wright State University
Interview Descriptions: Got an interview and accepted the job within a week. Very flexible schedule and an understanding boss! I get to pick my hours as a student worker with respect to my social life and education.
Interview Questions: Background experience value Communication proficiency

title: Gallery Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was thorough and involved multiple faculty members, a meeting with the dean, and ample opportunity to discuss the various facets of the position. However, I was quite dismayed that I was not reimbursed for travel.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in collection management

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Wright State University
Interview Descriptions: It was seamless. Great opportunity to learn about the student activities available on campus. It was a work study job so I was able to go to class when needed
Interview Questions:
Why I was interested
How my customer skills are

title: Human Resources Business Partner HRBP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wright State University (Fairborn, OH) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Video interview with scripted questions and little interpersonal engagement.  Four interviewers in a video-interview with a limited time frame did not allow for valuable engagement nor interaction.  A second interview was with the leader and peer position - and that felt more personal and informative.
Interview Questions: Why are  you interested in this position?

title: Programmer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wright State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was super easy. You usually go through 2 short interviews. They asked about very basic questions, like where you live, how you commute, and what your availability is. One question they asked was what you think good hospitality is. You know right after if you are hired or not.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself."

title: Human Resources Business Partner HRBP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone interview. Panel interview on zoom. Interview with leader. Panel Interview was stiffled, hard to engage with panel, short answers, dull. The panel interview was so flat and lame
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Imagery Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wright State University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with Bob Meyers. Interview was simple, very basic questions. How would you describe yourself, what’s your major, how would you handle this situation...etc. Bob is extremely nice.  The interview was one on one and formal.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wright State University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was really smooth and more friendly . There was a panel of 3 , department chair and 2 other high ranked professor , they mostly ask skill that yo have and behavioral questions.
Interview Questions:
What office skills do you have ?
Situational Questions .

title: Lab Ta Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Wright State University
Interview Descriptions: Most departments simply looks for students and/or Grad students willing to take extra hours for teaching classes. Person in-charge of scheduling will then send paperwork to give to Raider Express, which then processes the paperwork. Takes less than a few hours.
Interview Questions: None, they simply look at grades for certain classes.

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Wright State University (County Line, Cullman, AL) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Several interviews, difficult time with the application.  Takes a long time to complete the app.  Did not hear for several months.  Pay was not discussed or mentioned until after position was offered.  Would probably not have completed the process knowing  salary.
Interview Questions: What has prepared you for this position?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: had a ten minute phone interview with the academic program director and was offered a position at the end of the call due to my GPA. overall the interview was easy and straightforward.
Interview Questions: scenario based questions

title: Supplimental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Got recommended my a professor. Interview was 1-on-1 with a manager and asked simple questions about working with others, experience as a TA, and typical interview questions (how would you handle a difficult person? etc)
Interview Questions: Do you check your email?

title: Manager of Medical Student Career Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wright State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was comfortable and easy. I was not offered a job and was not told why I wasn't offered the job. I assume they found a better candidate.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are the best fit for this position?

title: Test Proctor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wright State University in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview went over basic skills to determine whether or not you can accomplish basic office tasks. Being able to speak to students and professors in a professional manner is most of the job.
Interview Questions: What is your availability like?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wright State University
Interview Descriptions: Wright State was a great place to work. Interview process took about 3 weeks. I was contacted by the lab. Met with the lab manager and then with the P.I. We discussed the experiments we would be doing and the team I would be working with.
Interview Questions: What are your previous research experiences and how did they help you?

title: Student Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wright State University
Interview Descriptions: Was easy simple questions, called quickly after i had applied. feel this process was easy and well explained. I think that the HR department did a really good job of ensuring everything was done correctly. The office did their part of setting up the time and ensuring everything went smoothly
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the team, asked about previous experience

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Wright State University in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions:
There is a class to take for anyone who wants to be an RA. It is a one credit class which counts as an elective in most majors. 

The class is used to see the team work and group situation functioning of the candidates. 

Individual and group interviews are held after the conclusion of the class.  These ask about desire and ability to do the job.

Simple process, and easy to complete!
Interview Questions: explain a situation where you dealt with conflict and how it was resolved.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview to obtain a graduate teaching assistantship. The assignments of teaching assistants are provided based on the number of positions they have available and they typically will give spots to those who have been at the school the longest (i.e. went to undergrad at the university).
Interview Questions: No questions for the interview.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online and got called back for an interview. When I arrived I was interviewed by a panel of three people; the director, his assistant and my soon-to-be supervisor. The interview process is very basic and bare-bones.
Interview Questions: What are you future goals?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed in the fields of different streams of maths and handling capabilities of all kinds of students. There were questions posed about handling capabilities of handicapped students. Tested on explanation procedure by giving a math problem and asked to explain to employer so he can make a decision on my explanation skills.
Interview Questions: How will you handle different kinds of students?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Wright State University (New York, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was no real process; I submitted my resume to the department coordinator. I was contacted when there was a need for an instructor in a topic where I qualified. I agreed to the semester, and I was sent to HR to fill out employment paperwork.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable teaching in this topic?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Wright State University in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth interview pricesss with the professors and students. Had lunch with the students. Appreciated my Cv. Very friendly atmosphere. Many possible options to choose from. That’s is all i I I I could remember
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had to approach different professors based on my interest. The professors were accommodating and provided details and all the requirements. Professors provided good timeline for the projects. They gave clarity on the funding also.
Interview Questions: The areas of interest

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
1) Saw the Job posting on our career services website and applied for it
2) After one week, got a call for interview
3) Two people interviewed me
4) After two days I got a call that I was selected :-)
5) Completed employer agreement documents
6) Applied for Social Security Number.
7) After getting SSN, I started working
Interview Questions:
Q: Why this job?
Q: what are your strengths and weekness?
Q: Tell about your previous work experience?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wright State University
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process is complex. They'll have you complete typing and software exams with other applicants just to be considered. If you score well enough, you might get an interview. It seems most of these jobs already have someone picked out, usually internally.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest flaw?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: As I was already a Graduate Research Assistant with the same research lab at the time, this interview was for a potential transition into a full-time Software Engineer role. The interview was short, and consisted of three panel members (professors and a research scientist). It mostly consisted of me describing what my contributions were to past relevant projects in the lab. They focused on some design decisions, and asked me to justify them.
Interview Questions: Hypothetically, [given a description of their system], describe in as much detail as possible how you would integrate multiple streaming data sources.

title: International Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wright State University
Interview Descriptions: They seemed happy with wavy I said but I didn't get the offer. It would have been a good experience. They told me in the interview that it's seasonal job. They also said that it might be a an on-call kind of task whenever new students arrive to the United States. . The most difficult question is why do you think why do you think you can handle the stress of the job.
Interview Questions: . The most difficult question is why do you think why do you think you can handle the stress of the job.

title: Accounting Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wright State University
Interview Descriptions: For staff positions, HR will review all resumes that are submitted and choose the top 10.  Those applicants are scheduled to test on various software (Word, Excel, etc) at the HR office.  The top scorers are then submitted to the hiring department for interviewing.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was associated with the professor for a long time and had interviewed right before offer was made. I was asked to present my work and was critiqued for it.
Interview Questions: Tel me your role in the lab in the past semester

title: Manager of Plant Operations and Maintenance Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Took far too long from the date of initial application.  Initial interview was a panel interview with representatives from Human Resources, other external Department Heads, Cultural Change Management Consultant, Support Staff from the hiring Department, and the Department Director.  There was not a second interview.  However, I was asked to submit a written response to multiple questions about management style, what I planned to do first if hired and some details technical questions.
Interview Questions: How do I handle changes in the workplace?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Only one interview where technical skills required to get the job done were discussed. Very practical and straight forward questions. The department chair had a genuine care about helping his research assistants to balance their studies and research work.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a situation you worked under pressure and how you handled it.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wright State University
Interview Descriptions: it was fairly easy to get the job,somehow, it is also challenge to be a great TA, I try my best to help the students in all manners.
Interview Questions: not too much

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Wright State University (Fairborn, OH) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Review with Department lead going over requirements, discussion of teaching process, sample class and test on skills and statistical and research knowledge. Reviewed school grading standards, students. Graduate school average grading curve.
Interview Questions: Experience and a sample presentation discussion

title: Broadcast Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very brief. I didn't feel as though they received a lot of useful information from me. Being as though the position was for students, there wasn't a lot of job history on my resume. They really ended up asking personal questions to get to know me better. The questions were less about why I am qualified for the job and more geared towards if I am someone they would be able to work with personality-wise.
Interview Questions: Are you involved with any community services groups or other organizations.

title: Writing Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was very nervous--it was my first job at Wright State, and one of the first I'd had to have an interview for... or at least, an interview that mattered. David Bringhurst, the director, asked typical interview questions, and there were two other WC employees in the room. It was a summer interview, and the room was very warm with the door closed. Combined with my nervousness, I barely remember most of the interview. David was calm, and actually helped me get over my nervousness. Part of the earlier process had been a review of my grammar skills, and a several questions that I needed to answer as part of establishing my personality and work ethic.
Interview Questions: What is one mistake you've made, and how did you learn from it?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line, and was initially interview on the telephone by 2-3 members of the search committee. I was then Interviewed by search committee, and had a meeting with the other faculty and staff and then gave an open presentation of my research to anyone interested, but attended mostly by the search committee. I was interviewed 1-1 with the chair of the department and by the Dean of the College. I also gave a presentation to a class of students. Their input was sought in a paper format.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to teach at WSU?
What is your philosophy of Education?
What strengths do you bring to this institution?
What are your research goals?
What are your teaching strengths?
Are you culturally competent? Give examples.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Found job online, applied. One week later contacted and formally interviewed got the job!
Interview Questions: How would you use mobile technology to improve a project

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Process is slow and arduous.
Interview Questions: What did you dislike about your last job?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wright State University (Dayton, OH) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was about to graduate and needed a job. Phone interview went well. It was followed by in-person interview, which went well. I was new to the job world and didn't care/worry too much about other things - just wanted a job. Nothing negative to say about interview process.
Interview Questions: N/A
